title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 346.5 - Back belt or support
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 346.5 - Back belt or support

State Regulations

In cases where the chiropractor prescribes a back belt or
support for a claimant, the chiropractor shall notify the employer or carrier
of the need for such belt or support and direct the claimant to the employer or
carrier for the purpose of securing from said employer or carrier authorization
for the purchase of such belt or support before the same is furnished to the
claimant by the supplier. Such belt or support also may be furnished by the
chiropractor who is in charge of the case or by a chiropractor who is not in
charge of the case upon certification of need by the attending chiropractor by
the physician having supervision of the case. If the belt or support is
furnished by a chiropractor who is not in charge of the case, neither the
chiropractor or physician in charge of the case nor the chiropractor furnishing
the belt or support shall directly or indirectly request, receive or
participate in the division, transference, assignment, rebating, splitting or
refunding of the fee or price for, or directly or indirectly request, receive
or profit by means of a credit or other valuable consideration as a commission, discount or gratuity in connection with the furnishing of, such belt or
support. Notes

346.5

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
